paragraphs.content: To the chief Musician, even to Jeduthun, A Psalm of David.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the chief Musician, even to Jeduthun, A Psalm of David.

paragraphs.content: I said, I will take heed to my ways, that I sin not with my tongue: I will keep my mouth with a bridle, while the wicked is before me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I said, I will take heed to my ways, that I sin not with my tongue: I will keep my mouth with a bridle, while the wicked is before me.

paragraphs.content: I was dumb with silence, I held my peace, even from good; and my sorrow was stirred.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I was dumb with silence, I held my peace, even from good; and my sorrow was stirred.

paragraphs.content: My heart was hot within me, while I was musing the fire burned: then spake I with my tongue,
paragraphs.contentHtml: My heart was hot within me, while I was musing the fire burned: then spake I with my tongue,

paragraphs.content: LORD, make me to know mine end, and the measure of my days, what it is; that I may know how frail I am.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lord, make me to know mine end, and the measure of my days, what it is; that I may know how frail I am.

paragraphs.content: Behold, thou hast made my days as an handbreadth; and mine age is as nothing before thee: verily every man at his best state is altogether vanity. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, thou hast made my days as an handbreadth; and mine age is as nothing before thee: verily every man at his best state is altogether vanity. Selah.

paragraphs.content: Surely every man walketh in a vain shew: surely they are disquieted in vain: he heapeth up riches, and knoweth not who shall gather them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Surely every man walketh in a vain shew: surely they are disquieted in vain: he heapeth up riches, and knoweth not who shall gather them.

paragraphs.content: And now, Lord, what wait I for? my hope is in thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And now, Lord, what wait I for? my hope is in thee.

paragraphs.content: Deliver me from all my transgressions: make me not the reproach of the foolish.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Deliver me from all my transgressions: make me not the reproach of the foolish.

paragraphs.content: I was dumb, I opened not my mouth; because thou didst it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I was dumb, I opened not my mouth; because thou didst it.

paragraphs.content: Remove thy stroke away from me: I am consumed by the blow of thine hand.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Remove thy stroke away from me: I am consumed by the blow of thine hand.

paragraphs.content: When thou with rebukes dost correct man for iniquity, thou makest his beauty to consume away like a moth: surely every man is vanity. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When thou with rebukes dost correct man for iniquity, thou makest his beauty to consume away like a moth: surely every man is vanity. Selah.

paragraphs.content: Hear my prayer, O LORD, and give ear unto my cry; hold not thy peace at my tears: for I am a stranger with thee, and a sojourner, as all my fathers were.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hear my prayer, O Lord, and give ear unto my cry; hold not thy peace at my tears: for I am a stranger with thee, and a sojourner, as all my fathers were.

paragraphs.content: O spare me, that I may recover strength, before I go hence, and be no more.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O spare me, that I may recover strength, before I go hence, and be no more.
